cast.overview: Wounded Civil War soldier John Dunbar tries to commit suicide—and becomes a hero instead. As a reward, he's assigned to his dream post, a remote junction on the Western frontier, and soon makes unlikely friends with the local Sioux tribe.
cast.title: Dances with Wolves

cast.overview: A team of elite commandos on a secret mission in a Central American jungle come to find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.
cast.title: Predator
cast.character: Guerilla Soldier Shot Down from Tree (uncredited)

crew.overview: Mulder and Scully, now taken off the FBI's X Files cases, must find a way to fight the shadowy elements of the government to find out the truth about a conspiracy that might mean the alien colonization of Earth.
crew.title: The X-Files

crew.overview: In 19th century England, Count Dracula travels to London and meets Mina Harker, a young woman who appears as the reincarnation of his lost love.
crew.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula

crew.overview: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison.
crew.title: The Doors

crew.overview: It's Christmastime, and the Griswolds are preparing for a family seasonal celebration. But things never run smoothly for Clark, his wife Ellen, and their two kids. Clark's continual bad luck is worsened by his obnoxious family guests, but he manages to keep going, knowing that his Christmas bonus is due soon.
crew.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

crew.overview: One year after his heroics in Los Angeles, John McClane is an off-duty cop who is the wrong guy in the wrong place at the wrong time. On a snowy Christmas Eve, as he waits for his wife's plane to land at Washington Dulles International Airport, terrorists take over the air traffic control system in a plot to free a South American army general and drug smuggler being flown into the US to face drug charges. It's now up to McClane to take on the terrorists, while coping with an inept airport police chief, an uncooperative anti-terrorist squad, and the life of his wife and everyone else trapped in planes circling overhead.
crew.title: Die Hard 2

crew.overview: After kidnapping a father and his two kids, the Gecko brothers head south to a seedy Mexican bar to hide out in safety, unaware of its notorious vampire clientele.
crew.title: From Dusk Till Dawn

crew.overview: The Borg, a relentless race of cyborgs, are on a direct course for Earth. Violating orders to stay away from the battle, Captain Picard and the crew of the newly-commissioned USS Enterprise E pursue the Borg back in time to prevent the invaders from changing Federation history and assimilating the galaxy.
crew.title: Star Trek: First Contact

crew.overview: Like some other kids, 12-year-old Trevor McKinney believed in the goodness of human nature. Like many other kids, he was determined to change the world for the better. Unlike most other kids, he succeeded.
crew.title: Pay It Forward

crew.overview: Hitman Martin Blank becomes a moving target after he rebuffs a fellow assassin's invitation to form a union. On the advice of his quirky assistant and neurotic psychiatrist, Martin begrudgingly heads out to Grosse Pointe, Michigan for his ten-year high school reunion, where he soon comes across the woman he jilted on prom night.
crew.title: Grosse Pointe Blank

details.biography:
William H. Burton, Jr. is an actor, stunt coordinator and stuntman. He is the son of talented stunt coordinator and stuntman William H. Burton.

He started his career in Hollywood as an actor. During the 1970s, he appeared in TV shows like The Immortal and The Quest, as well as films like Earthquake and Slumber Party '57. However, in 1987, Burton transitioned to a career as a stunt performer. Burton is a distinguished stunt performer and a member of Stunts Unlimited.

As a stunt performer, Burton has worked on films like Predators 2, Patriot Games, Godzilla, xXx, and The 40-Year Old Virgin. He has participated in more than 180 shoots.
details.name: William H. Burton Jr.
